channel.title: How to fix your 508 compiler
channel.description:
hello this is a tut for how to fix your compiler [508]
first go to your compiler and press edit than you see this:
[code]@echo off Title Berky-Scape Compiler cd .. "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./Bulby/./io/*.java echo Finished! pause [/code]
than change "jdk1.6.0_17"to your java version, then save en your compiler works what? you dont know wich version you have? ok im gonna tell you how to know that.
go to: C:\Program Files\Java
you'l see there your version.. that's it easy right??

item.title: How to fix your 508 compiler
item.dc:creator: @TrebaurLul TrebaurLul
item.description:
@TrebaurLul wrote:

Well, good effort and thanks for contributing to the community of course but really this tutorial is unneeded. It’s common sense that you need to edit your compile batch file if your JDK is not recognized.

Once again, good effort.

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix your 508 compiler
item.dc:creator: @brian9612 brian9612
item.description:
@brian9612 wrote:

hello this is a tut for how to fix your compiler [508]

first go to your compiler and press edit than you see this:

@echo off Title Berky-Scape Compiler cd .. "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./Bulby/./io/*.java echo Finished! pause

than change "jdk1.6.0_17"to your java version, then save en your compiler works
what? you dont know wich version you have? ok im gonna tell you how to know that.

go to: C:\Program Files\Java

you’l see there your version… that’s it easy right??
